result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario O Morales

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:04PM (64-06) Defendant Mario O Morales in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Mario O Morales.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Attorney Duquette is requesting more time to go over new files with his client.
No objection by the State.

Adj. 3:08PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Mario O Morales in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Mario O Morales.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Called @ 3:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance on 22CF467. Record by Atty. Duquette that he was just appointed, has gone over the charges and penalties, and is asking for preliminary hearing outside time limits. Further record as to new file - 22CF524 and asks to be appointed on that matter as well, and is seeking preliminary hearing as to that file as well.  Court orders him appointed on new file and will have amended order prepared.  
State responds to Court's questions regarding the open GF files that are also on the calendar. Response by the State that they will be filing charges once blood comes back as to OWI's and that GF should remain open and tracking. 
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF524, 22GF799 & 22CF467

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Mario O Morales in court. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court places defendant under oath. Court orders court appointed attorney. Existing bond to cover all files. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*See updated bond set 9/13/2022*
UNTIL FURTHER ORDER, THIS BOND IS SEPARATE FROM ANY BOND ALREADY ORDERED. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.
